docs.lead_paragraph: A poll showed broad distaste for the law, but found that people would rather have it improved than repealed.

headline.main: Southerners Don’t Like Obamacare. They Also Don’t Want to Repeal It.
headline.print_headline: In Poll, South Opposes Health Law, and Repeal

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Kaiser Family Foundation poll finds that despite strong dislike of President Obama's handling of health care, majority of people in three Southern states--Kentucky, Louisiana and North Carolina--would rather Congress improve his signature health care law than repeal and replace it; debate over the law is expected to dominate midterm elections, and all three states have political races that could tip balance of power in Senate.
docs.snippet: A poll showed broad distaste for the law, but found that people would rather have it improved than repealed.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Marina Stefan and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and ALLISON KOPICKI

docs.lead_paragraph: A new poll finds that conservatives dislike the government’s involvement in the Affordable Care Act; liberals wanted more.

headline.main: Health Law’s Middle-Ground Approach Leaves It Unloved

docs.snippet: A new poll finds that conservatives dislike the government’s involvement in the Affordable Care Act; liberals wanted more.

docs.lead_paragraph: Parents whose children were killed in a Colorado theater shooting on Wednesday demanded a conservative group stop running ads featuring an image of Democratic Sen. Mark Udall visiting a hospital where other victims were recovering.

docs.lead_paragraph: The FBI has warned healthcare providers their cybersecurity systems are lax compared to other sectors, making them vulnerable to attacks by hackers searching for Americans' personal medical records and health insurance data.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story April 23 about companies with social networks that match home cooks and diners, The Associated Press misspelled a cook's name. She is Amber Schreiner, not Shreiner.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spain's Bankinter reported a 19 percent rise in first-quarter net profit and said bad loans were close to a peak, setting a positive tone for the rest of the country's banks which are aiming to benefit from an improving economy.

headline.print_headline: Bankinter Profit Rise Sets Positive Tone for Spain's Banks
